meanings.definition: To resist or oppose authority or control.
meanings.sent1: The students decided to reist against the strict school rules.
meanings.sent2: The citizens began to reist the unjust government policies.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious cat seemed to reist wearing the new collar.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit reists any attempt to stifle her independence.
meanings.sent5: The mighty oak tree reists the strong winds, standing tall and proud.

meanings.sent1: The workers planned to reist the unfair treatment by going on strike.
meanings.sent2: The oppressed people decided to reist their oppressors and fight for freedom.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy puppy tried to reist bath time by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The waves reist the shore, crashing against the rocks with determination.
meanings.sent5: The hero's courage reists the darkness, shining brightly in the face of adversity.

meanings.definition: To refuse to comply or submit.
meanings.sent1: She would always reist any attempt to make her change her mind.
meanings.sent2: The prisoner continued to reist the interrogation, remaining silent.
meanings.sent3: The toddler would often reist bedtime, wanting to play just a little longer.
meanings.sent4: The wild horse reists being tamed, running free in the open fields.
meanings.sent5: His determination to succeed reists any obstacles in his path, driving him forward.
